movies.title: 100 Minutes of Glory
movies.plot: True story about the tragic life of a famous late 19th century deaf female Croatian watercolor painter Slava Raskaj.
movies.simplePlot: True story about the tragic life of a famous late 19th century deaf female Croatian watercolor painter Slava Raskaj.

biography.bio: Sanja Vejnovic was born on August 8, 1961 in Zagreb, Croatia, Yugoslavia. She is an actress and producer, known for Larin izbor (2011), Ponos Ratkajevih (2007) and 100 Minutes of Glory (2004). She was previously married to Goran Mecava.
biography.name: Sanja Vejnovic

biography.bio: Predrag 'Miki' Manojlovic was born on April 5, 1950 in Belgrade, Serbia, Yugoslavia as Predrag Manojlovic. He is an actor and director, known for Underground (1995), Na terapiji (2009) and The World Is Big (2008).
biography.name: Predrag 'Miki' Manojlovic

biography.bio: Vili Matula was born on March 5, 1962 in Zagreb, Croatia, Yugoslavia. He is an actor, known for Schindler's List (1993), Forest Creatures (2010) and Rosencrantz & Guildenstern Are Dead (1990).
biography.name: Vili Matula

biography.bio: Natasa Lusetic is an actress, known for 100 Minutes of Glory (2004), Comanche Territory (1997) and The Old Oak Blues (2000).
biography.name: Natasa Lusetic

biography.bio: Krunoslav Saric was born on June 21, 1944 in Derventa, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Yugoslavia. He is an actor, known for Dolina sunca (2009), You Carry Me (2015) and Sokol Did Not Love Him (1988).
biography.name: Krunoslav Saric

biography.bio: Nada Gacesic was born on October 8, 1951 in Pozega, Croatia/Hrvatska. She is an actress, known for Luda kuca (2005), Villa Maria (2004) and Nausikaja (1995). She is married to Mirko Livakoviæ. They have one child.
biography.name: Nada Gacesic

biography.bio: Luka Petrusic was born on September 15, 1982 in Zagreb, Croatia. He is an actor, known for Bumerang (2005), I Want You (1998) and Sorry for Kung Fu (2004).
biography.name: Luka Petrusic

biography.bio: Darko Rundek was born in 1956 in Zagreb, Croatia, Yugoslavia. He is a composer and actor, known for God Forbid a Worse Thing Should Happen (2002), Ginger: More Than a Game (2011) and Tri muskarca Melite Zganjer (1998).
biography.name: Darko Rundek

biography.bio: Maja Anusic is an actress, known for 100 Minutes of Glory (2004).
biography.name: Maja Anusic

biography.bio: Ivana Bolanca was born on March 2, 1977 in Zagreb, Croatia, Yugoslavia. She is an actress, known for Ponos Ratkajevih (2007), Najbolje godine (2009) and Loving Glances (2003).
biography.name: Ivana Bolanca

biography.bio: Jasna Beri was born on January 2, 1954 in Zenica, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Yugoslavia. She is an actress, known for Esma's Secret - Grbavica (2006), Premières neiges (2008) and In the Land of Blood and Honey (2011).
biography.name: Jasna Beri

biography.bio: Kresimir Mikic was born on April 17, 1974 in Osijek, Croatia, Yugoslavia. He is an actor, known for Bonté divine (2013), The Lika Cinema (2009) and Fine Dead Girls (2002).
biography.name: Kresimir Mikic

biography.bio: Bojan Navojec is Croatian film and stage actor with an extraordinary charm and personal warmth, attracted attention as a student. Throughout his career, he worked with leading Croatian and regional directors, appeared in more than 70 films and 50 theatre plays across major Croatian theatre. In 2010 he joined Croatian National Theatre drama. Navojec graduated from University of Zagreb School of Drama in 2010. Today, he is acting class adjunct faculty at the School, teaching "Acting on Camera". He is recipient of numerous Croatian acting awards.
biography.name: Bojan Navojec

biography.bio: Saw his first film at the age of three. Made the first (8mm) film at the age of 14. Studied film at Cine Club Beograd, and University of Dramatic Arts, Belgrade, Yu. In the capacities of company executive, producer, writer and director worked on 32 feature films, several TV series, and over 60 short films. Taught film history and theory at Webster University, Geneva Switzerland; taught TV dramaturgy at International Academy of Broadcasting, Montreux, Switzerland. Presentlly, independent producer working, thorugh his company Globe Plan
biography.name: Milan Zivkovic

biography.bio: Profesional acting career started as 16 years old lad (1953) in movie Sinji galeb (part of Pero, credited as Darko Slivnjak) directed by famous Croatian director Branko Bauer. 1950-1953 member of amateur group which is today Zagrebacko kazaliste mladih (Zagrebian Theatre of Youngsters); 1953-1957 student at The Academy of Dramatic Arts in Zagreb; 1957 - 1973 permanent member of Zagrebian Drama Theatre (today City Drama Theatre Gavella); 1970 - 1973 professor at the Academy of Dramatic Arts in Zagreb. 1973 - 1974 manager and director of Drama department of Croatian National Theatre in Osijek; 1974 - 1977 free-lance and at the same time member of Teater &td in Zagreb. During 1977 manager of Estrade Theatre ESTA in Zagreb. 1978 - 1984 permanent member of Drama department of Croatian National Theatre in Zagreb as an actor and for short time (1983) as publicity director. Since 1984 free-lance again, mostly engaged in various films made by foreign productions. Since September 2003 to present days is leading Netfaces - First Croatian Casting Organization on the Internet, working at the same time as casting director, director, actor, dialogue coach and teacher of acting.
biography.name: Bozidar Smiljanic
